Name: Hoyt's Daiquirí
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of seared lime slice wheel.
Sear two halves of lime with a chef's blow torch and squeeze into a shaker.
Add other ingredients and SHAKE with ice.
Review: Most unusual and interesting. Recognisably a Daiquiri but with a creamy mouthfeel and great depth of flavour.
History: Created in 2008 by Meimi Sanchez at Bramble in Edinburgh, Scotland.
Nutrition: One serving of Hoyt's Daiquirí contains 213 calories
